de.systemagmbh.interfaces.database
Interface ISysDBRequester

All Superinterfaces:
ISysComponent
All Known Implementing Classes:
DummyISysDBRequester
public interface ISysDBRequester
extends ISysComponent

This is the base for all database connection classes.

Version:
$Revision: 1.17 $
Author:
Udo Friedrich

                        Object[] args)

args - The arguments for the update (e.g. 2, "ade")

select

public ISysTable select(String key,
                        int max)
                 throws CSysDBRException
Send a select statement to the database

Parameters:
key - A String, representing the request, for example "EquipmentManager.equipmentList"
max - The maximal number of lines returned in the ISysTable.
If <1 all found results will be returned.
Returns:
CSysResultTable with contens of the select
Throws:
CSysDBRException

args - The arguments for the update (e.g. 2, "ade")
max - The maximal number of lines returned in the ISysTable.
If <1 all found results will be returned.

CSysDBRException

directSelect

public ISysTable directSelect(String selectString)
                       throws CSysDBRException
Execute a selection directly, i.e. without using a prepared statement. Should only be used if it is not possible to use prepared statements. These things will not appear in the statement file!

Parameters:
selectString - The SQL-String to be executed.
Returns:
the selected lines as a CSysResultTable.
Throws:
CSysDBRException

directSelect

public ISysTable directSelect(String selectString,
                              int maxReturnRows)
                       throws CSysDBRException
Execute a selection directly, i.e. without using a prepared statement. Should only be used if it is not possible to use prepared statements. These things will not appear in the statement file!

Parameters:
selectString - The SQL-String to be executed.
maxReturnRows - The maximal number of lines returned in the ISysTable.
If <1 all found results will be returned.
Returns:
the selected lines as a CSysResultTable.
Throws:
CSysDBRException

directExecute

public int directExecute(String sqlString)
                  throws CSysDBRException
Execute a update/insert/delete directly, i.e. without using a prepared statement. Should only be used if it is not possible to use prepared statements. These things will not appear in the statement file!

Parameters:
sqlString - The SQL-String to be executed.
Returns:
the number of updated/inserted/deleted lines.
Throws:
CSysDBRException

update

public int update(String key,
                  Object[] args)
           throws CSysDBRException
Send a update statement to the database

Parameters:
key - A String, representing the request, for example "EquipmentManager.equipmentList"
args - The arguments for the update (e.g. 2, "ade")
Returns:
the number of updated rows.
Throws:
CSysDBRException

                  ISysTable rt)
           throws CSysDBRException
Send a update statement to the database

Parameters:
key - A String, representing the request, for example "EquipmentManager.equipmentList"
rt - The result table
Returns:
number of updated rows.
Throws:
CSysDBRException

insert

public Integer insert(String key,
                      Object[] args)
               throws CSysDBRException
Send a insert statement to the database

Parameters:
key - A String, representing the request, for example "EquipmentManager.equipmentList"
args - The arguments for the update (e.g. 2, "ade")
Returns:
the new id or 'null' if no id had to be created.
Throws:
CSysDBRException

insert

public Integer[] insert(String key,
                        ISysTable rt)
                 throws CSysDBRException
Send a insert statement to the database

Parameters:
key - A String, representing the request, for example "EquipmentManager.equipmentList"
rt - The result table
Returns:
number of inserted rows, -1 if insert failed
Throws:
CSysDBRException

                  Object[] args)
           throws CSysDBRException
Send a delete statement to the database

Parameters:

args - The arguments for the update (e.g. 2, "ade")
Returns:
the number of deleted rows.
Throws:
CSysDBRException

callProcedure

public void callProcedure(ISysProcedureParameter procParameter)
                   throws CSysDBRException
Executes a database stored procedure using the parameter specified in procParameter. If OUT parameter are registered, their result values are available by the by-reference-parameter procParameter.

Parameters:
procParameter - object containing stored procedure parameter
Throws:
CSysDBRException
See Also:
ISysProcedureParameter
